citation.title: Crystal structure of human malate dehydrogenase type 2.

reference.scope: X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (1.90 ANGSTROMS) OF 20-338 IN COMPLEX WITH NAD AND SUBSTRATE
SUBUNIT

comment.text: Enzyme activity is enhanced by acetylation.

Acetylation is enhanced by up to 67% after treatment either with trichostin A (TSA) or with nicotinamide (NAM) with the appearance of tri- and tetraacetylations. Glucose also increases acetylation by about 60%.

disease.name: Epileptic encephalopathy, early infantile, 51
disease.description: A form of epileptic encephalopathy, a heterogeneous group of severe childhood onset epilepsies characterized by refractory seizures, neurodevelopmental impairment, and poor prognosis. Development is normal prior to seizure onset, after which cognitive and motor delays become apparent. EIEE51 is an autosomal recessive form characterized by onset of intractable seizures and hypotonia in the first days or weeks of life, and severely delayed psychomotor development.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the LDH/MDH superfamily. MDH type 1 family.

feature.description: In EIEE51; severe defects in aerobic respiration, when assayed in a heterologous system; dbSNP:rs782308462.
In EIEE51; decreased protein abundance; strong decrease in malate dehydrogenase activity; severe defects in aerobic respiration, when assayed in a heterologous system; dbSNP:rs375002796.
